headline: What Catalysts Could Shift the Narrative for HCA Healthcare Stock?
summary: HCA Healthcare stock has seen a modest bump in analyst price targets, with the consensus estimate rising from $471 to approximately $476.67 per share. This upward adjustment follows strong quarterly performance and improving payment trends noted by the analyst community. Stay tuned to discover how investors can monitor shifts in sentiment and keep ahead of changes in the stock’s outlook going forward. Analyst Price Targets don't always capture the full story. headline: HCA Healthcare (HCA): Assessing Valuation After Revenue Growth, Florida Expansions, and Upbeat 2025 Outlook
summary: HCA Healthcare (HCA) is drawing fresh attention as its recent results highlight a substantial rise in revenue, supported by growing patient demand and ongoing expansions across several Florida hospitals. headline: HCA Healthcare Surpasses 100,000 Pounds of Collected Medication in Year Seven of Annual "Crush the Crisis"
summary: NASHVILLE, Tenn., November 13, 2025--HCA Healthcare, Inc. (NYSE:HCA), one of the nation’s leading healthcare providers, today announced that it collected 19,846 pounds, approximately 13.6 million doses, of unused or expired medications during its seventh annual "Crush the Crisis" national prescription drug take back day. In total, the organization has now collected more than 108,500 pounds of medication since launching "Crush the Crisis" as an enterprise initiative in 2019.

content.title: HCA Healthcare Surpasses 100,000 Pounds of Collected Medication in Year Seven of Annual "Crush the Crisis"
content.summary: NASHVILLE, Tenn., November 13, 2025--HCA Healthcare, Inc. (NYSE:HCA), one of the nation’s leading healthcare providers, today announced that it collected 19,846 pounds, approximately 13.6 million doses, of unused or expired medications during its seventh annual "Crush the Crisis" national prescription drug take back day. In total, the organization has now collected more than 108,500 pounds of medication since launching "Crush the Crisis" as an enterprise initiative in 2019.
